Pressing this button will allow you to teleport back to your chosen Temple of Tyr. However, it will penalize you as if you have respawned.

1. No griefing or trolling.
2. No forcing of other players to roleplay.
3. No erotic or sexual content.
4. No PvP without consent.
5. No exploiting or hacks.
What section would you like to look at?
Quarterstaves and shurikens now count as monk weapons alongside kamas.

Mounted Combat is required to attack while mounted.

Mounted Archery is required to use range attacks while mounted.

Whenever you take damage while mounted, you must make a ride check vs 10 + damage/3 or be knocked down.
Items can only be identified by Eltoora in the Cloaktower. Items can be sold to Olgerd in the Dock's district.
Healing kits cannot be used in combat.
Gold is equally divided amongst the party, and items are randomly rewarded. Only players that are present when mobs are killed or when the treasure is opened will be eligible to loot.

Levels are capped to level 12.

Summons, familiars, and animal companions do not affect XP.

Party members must be within 3 levels or XP will not be given.

Multi-class penalties are not enabled. Instead, favored racial classes get a bonus if they have at least one level in that class. For example, an Elven Wizard will get 10% more XP.

There is a special case for humans and half-elves. Instead of a racial class bonus, they gain a bonus dependent on the amount of different classes. Dual-classed humans and half elves gain 5% more XP. Triple-classed humans and half-elves gain 10% more XP.

Wisdom gives 2% more XP for every point above 10. Vice versa for wisdom below 10. Cumulative with favored racial bonuses.

Henchman can be hired from the "Trade of Blades" in the city core. They automatically scale to your level, and will respawn there when killed or dismissed. They will take some share of the loot and gold, however.
Resting in most places is dangerous and you will have a chance to get ambushed. Rangers have a reduced chance of resting encounters.

Area of effect spells do not stack.

Weapon buff spells do not stack.

Summon Creature and Lesser Planar Ally spells have been rebalanced.

Evil clerics and blackguards can dominate undead instead of destroying them. They can only control a total number of undead with a combined HD equal to or less than the clerics level.

Invisibility spells now last in rounds and have a diminishing return, capped at 25%. This is cleared on rest. However, the concealment from improved invisibility will still last in turns and will always apply. 

Invisibility sphere ignores this rule, but only lasts 1 round for every 3 caster levels.

Knock: Ability Mod + Spell Level + Spell Focus + d20 vs Unlock DC.

Find Traps: Ability Mod + Spell Level + Spell Focus + d20 vs Disarm DC.

True Seeing: No longer gives true sight, but +20 spot, See Invis, and Ultravision.

Level 12 cap.

Heavy emphasis on quest and story based on the original campaign, roleplay not enforced.

Max HP rolls.
Challenging encounters.

Close to vanilla with minimal class/spell changes.

+3 item enhancement cap, no permanent "True Seeing", "Haste", "Freedom of Movement" etc. item properties.

Henchman available.
